new Error(errorNumber, formatString, extraData, previousError) → {Error}

Create a new Error
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
errorNumber String | Number | Object The error string, or an error number, or an error descriptor.
formatString Array.<String> | String <optional>
<repeatable>
 An array of string for replacement.
extraData Object <optional>
 The extra data to display
previousError Error <optional>
 The previous error met.
Source:

Returns:
Created javascript error.
Type
Error
Examples
     new Error("Failed to open file {0}", "/home/karl/test.js");
     new Error(Error.login.NO_NAME);

Methods

<static> addIgnoranceRules(rules)

Add a new ignorance package rule. Ignorance is a string or a regex used to remove unnecessary words from default namespaces. This function is used when you want to store your errors under a folder with specific names, and then you should provide the correct name with {@see Error.require}.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
rules RegExp | String | Array.<(RegExp|String)> The regex rule or string descriptor of ignorance rule
Source:
  • error.js, line 322
Example
     Error.addIgnoranceRules("error"); // "org.cauchies.error.login" => org.cauchies.login
     Error.addIgnoranceRules(/error/i); //"org.cauchies.Error.login" => org.caucheis.login

<static> addKeywordHandler(keyword, handler)

Add a keyword for translate descriptors. When creating new Error object, it will parse the descriptor, and handle all descriptor attributes. Each attribute of descriptor will be corresponding to an keyword.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
keyword String The keyword to detect.
handler KeywordHandler The event handler.
Source:
  • error.js, line 189
See:
  • KeywordHandler
